com.cubeia.firebase.api.service.dosprotect
Interface Rule

All Known Implementing Classes:
FrequencyRule
public interface Rule

Rules are stateful objects which determine if access is allowed for callers according to their internal logic.

For house keeping purposes, the cleanup() method will be called by the service regularly.

Author:
Larsan

Method Summary
 boolean allow(Object callerId, RuleChain chain)
          Check if a caller is allowed access.
 void cleanup()
          This method is called regularly by the service.
 

Method Detail

allow

boolean allow(Object callerId,
              RuleChain chain)
Check if a caller is allowed access. This method should either return false if the caller is not allowed, or return the result of invoking the "next" method on the rule chain which will check the next rule.

Parameters:
callerId - Caller id, never null
chain - Chain to pass on to if the access is granted, never null
Returns:
The return value of the chains "next" method, or false if the request is denied

cleanup

void cleanup()
This method is called regularly by the service. The rule should use this call to cleanup resources.
